bill.summary:
Federal Emergency Mobilization Accountability (FEMA) Workforce Planning Act
This bill requires the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) to develop and submit to Congress every three years a human capital operating plan to shape and improve FEMAâ€™s workforce.
Specifically, the plan must include performance measures to track staffing and training, an analysis of the current workforce and possible gaps in staffing or skills, and a plan of action to address such gaps. The plan must discuss the membership and training of the Surge Capacity Force, through which federal employees deploy in response to a catastrophic disaster.
FEMA must submit the first plan within one year after the billâ€™s enactment and subsequent plans at least once every three years.
The bill also requires the Government Accountability Office to submit a report analyzing whether FEMAâ€™s plan meets the requirements of the bill, including any recommendations to ensure subsequent plans meet the requirements.
